articles.author: By Mike Hayes, Melissa Macaya, Melissa Mahtani, Meg Wagner and Veronica Rocha, CNN
articles.title: The latest on the Covid-19 pandemic and the US's reopening: Live updates - CNN
articles.description: About half of Americans having received at least one dose of a Covid-19 vaccine as more coronavirus mandates and restrictions ease. Follow here for the latest.
articles.content: Twelve states have now reached the Biden administrations goal to vaccinate 70% of adults with at least one dose of Covid-19 vaccine by July 4, according to data published Tuesday by the US Center for… [+859 chars]

articles.author: Leah Stanfield
articles.title: Anti-vaxxer seriously ill with Covid after claiming jabs will kill 'stupid people' - Daily Express
articles.description: AN AMERICAN conspiracy theorist has become extremely ill with Covid after refusing the vaccine and saying it will 'kill off stupid people'.

articles.author: Jennifer Hansler, CNN
articles.title: Exclusive: American imprisoned in Russia calls on Biden to take 'decisive action' to stop detention of US citizens - CNN
articles.description: Paul Whelan, an American imprisoned in Russia, called on President Joe Biden to "aggressively discuss and resolve" the issue of US citizens being detained for political purposes when he meets President Vladimir Putin at a summit later this month.

articles.description: America's Got Talent season 16 premiered last night and featured live audiences and Judge Simon Cowell too. The first Golden Buzzer was awarded at the premiere!

articles.title: Sailing: Hosting next America's Cup in Auckland 'doesn't make sense', says leading economist - Newshub
articles.description: "When governments compete with each other to subsidise boat races that rich people tend to enjoy, the winners aren't taxpayers."
articles.content:
Before the last Cup, the Council and Government spent $289m on clearing the tank farm, building the bases, and hosting the event.

articles.title: Biden honours victims of Tulsa race massacre on 100th anniversary of killings - CBC.ca
articles.description: Joe Biden on Tuesday became the first sitting U.S. president to visit the site of the massacre of hundreds of Black Americans by a white mob in Tulsa, Okla., as he marks one of the worst chapters in the country's history of racial violence.

articles.title: Vaccinated Americans are celebrating the 1st big holiday safely without masks. But for some, returning to normal is not so easy - KION
articles.description: For the first time in over a year, millions of Americans are gathering for a major holiday without masks or physical distancing — safely. But the majority of Americans still aren’t fully vaccinated, leading to the possibility of yet another post-holiday spike…
